key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs consistently charge around 0.10–0.17% above the website, with no cheaper fares observed.
MSE shows frequent cheaper fares (45%), though this has declined from 60% last month; 29% of fares are higher.
GDS holds a near-total premium for 97–100% of flights, with no lower or same fares identified.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of itineraries display higher OTA prices with minimal weekly variation.
No matched or lower fares surfaced, leaving the direct channel as the cheapest option.
OTA prices exceed the airline site by about 0.10%, indicating a modest gap.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA N/A remains low at roughly 3–5%, with no significant shifts over time.
No instances of price parity were identified in the data.
Covers 95–100% of checked itineraries with about a 0.10–0.17% mark-up over the airline’s site.
No occurrences of lower OTA prices were observed.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA higher stands at 96% of short-haul checks with a stable 0.10% premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA higher near 95%, with a minor 0.08–0.09% price gap from the airline.
OTA higher at ~98%, consistently applying a 0.12% premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94.92% of close-in queries are higher on OTAs, showing a difference near 0.06–0.07%.
All far-out fares trend higher on OTAs by about 0.17%, unchanged across weeks.

mse_highlights.line_content: 45% of monitored fares were lower on MSE last week, down 15 points from last month.
29% of fares were more expensive on MSE last week, up 9 points from the previous month.
MSE aligned with airline website prices for 26% of cases, slightly improving from last month’s 20%.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Coverage remained near zero, indicating minimal availability on the channel.
Pricing aligned with 26% of fares last week, relatively steady from the previous week.
Share grew to 29% last week, reflecting a steady climb from 20% last month.
At 45%, though down from 60% last month, it remains the largest segment.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 45% of fares cheaper on MSE, 29% higher, the rest matched, tracking overall channel averages.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 53% cheaper on MSE, stable week over week, with moderate changes in other statuses.
MSE fares split evenly at 37% cheaper, 37% higher, 26% identical to website.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 57% cheaper on MSE, down from 70% last month, indicating a shift in pricing advantage.
54% higher on MSE, up 23% from last month, with only 21% cheaper fares.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 97% of routes were priced higher on GDS, demonstrating strong pricing above airline fares.
No same or cheaper GDS fares were seen, underscoring a near-total skew toward higher GDS pricing.
Far Out fares averaged a 0.16–0.17% premium, while Close In showed around 0.06–0.07%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Between 0–2% unavailability, indicating minimal coverage gaps.
None identified; no undercutting of airline website fares.
Consistent in 98–100% of cases, with mild weekly variation of ±1–2%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Nearly all short-haul itineraries priced higher on GDS (~98–99%), stable with a ~0.10% premium.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 97% priced higher on GDS, with a 0.08–0.09% premium on average.
Up to a 2.22% weekly rise in GDS-higher status, translating to ~0.12% fare premium.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Around 96–98% higher on GDS, with a smaller 0.06–0.07% surcharge.
All tested itineraries GDS-higher, showing the widest gap of about 0.16–0.17%.
